original: @1b # // 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa /
analyzed: @1b # // 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa /
translated: Noble Unraveling the Intention

original: bam po nyi shu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu drug pa /
translated: Twenty-sixth section

original: gzhan yang don dam yang dag 'phags sems can gang dag dang po nyid nas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang don dam yang dag 'phags sems can gang dag dang po nyid nas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: Furthermore, ‚ÄúParamƒÅrthasamudgata, those sentient beings who from the very beginning have not generated roots of virtue,

original: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa rgyud yongs su ma smin pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa rgyud yongs su ma smin pa /
translated: whose continuums are not completely purified of obscurations, whose continuums are not ripened,

original: mos pa mang du ma bsgoms pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis ma bsags pa dag la zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa gnas skabs las brtsams nas /
analyzed: mos pa mang du ma bsgoms pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis ma bsags pa dag la zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa gnas skabs las brtsams nas /
translated: who have not cultivated much interest, and who have not accumulated the two collections of merit and wisdom‚Äù and so forth below this point is the third, which begins with the topic of the occasion,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i dgongs pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i dgongs pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: and it teaches the intention of positing the three types of non-entityness.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: gnas skabs lnga las brtsams nas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan pa dang / de dag de ltar zhes bya ba man chad kyis sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyi ma gnyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs lnga las brtsams nas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan pa dang / de dag de ltar zhes bya ba man chad kyis sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyi ma gnyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The first two lines teach the lack of reality of arising from the five states, and the rest, ‚ÄúThey are not real in that way,‚Äù teach the last two kinds of unreality from the point of view of the states of application and so on.

original: yang rnal 'byor gyi sgo brjod na gnas skabs rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor gyi sgo brjod na gnas skabs rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: If one speaks of the door of yoga, there are five states.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /üîΩrnam par rig pa @2a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du / rnam par rig pa @2a * //
translated: As the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only says:

original: tsam gyis gnas skabs rnam pa lnga ji ltar khong du chud cing 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩdang po tshogs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tsam gyis gnas skabs rnam pa lnga ji ltar khong du chud cing 'jug par 'gyur zhe na / dang po tshogs kyi gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: How does one understand and enter the five states of consciousness only?

original: theg pa chen po bsgom pa rnam par grol ba'i cha dang mthun pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsgom pa rnam par grol ba'i cha dang mthun pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The first is the state of equipment, which is the Great Vehicle meditation that is conducive to liberation.

original: de ni dad pa bcu nas yongs su bsngo ba bcu'i bar dag go //
analyzed: de ni dad pa bcu nas yongs su bsngo ba bcu'i bar dag go //
translated: This is from the ten faiths to the ten dedications.

original: gnyis pa sbyor ba'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa sbyor ba'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the state of application, which is the Great Vehicle meditation that is conducive to penetration.

original: theg pa chen po bsgom pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsgom pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is the Great Vehicle meditation that is conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de ni yongs su bsngo ba rnam pa bcu las bcu pa sems yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su bsngo ba rnam pa bcu las bcu pa sems yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the tenth of the ten kinds of thorough dedication, called the thorough purification of the mind.

original: gsum pa rtog pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa rtog pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third stage is that of conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the stage of the bodhisattva who is on the path of seeing.

original: bzhi pa bsgom pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa bsgom pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth stage is that of meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the stage of the bodhisattva who is on the path of meditation.

original: lnga pa mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga pa mthar phyin pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fifth stage is that of culmination.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the stage of the bodhisattva who is on the path of no more learning.

original: 'dir mod 'di dang sbyar na rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'dir mod 'di dang sbyar na rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Here, it is divided into two parts, according to the present context.

original: dang po gnas skabs lnga las brtsams nas skye ba ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: dang po gnas skabs lnga las brtsams nas skye ba ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: First, the differentiation of the reality of origination is based on the five states.

original: @2b 'di ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa'i tshogs kyi lam dang po dang / dad pa bcu'i mdun rol du rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dag yin no //üîΩgnyis pa ni sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: @2b 'di ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa'i tshogs kyi lam dang po dang / dad pa bcu'i mdun rol du rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dag yin no // gnyis pa ni sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa las brtsams nas /
translated: These are the first stage of the path of instruction in the treatise Establishing Perception-Only, and they are the roots of virtue of the side of liberation that precede the ten faiths.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa phyi ma gnyis rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa phyi ma gnyis rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Second, the differentiation of the latter two unrealities is based on the path of preparation and so on.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa'i gnas skabs bar ma gsum po dag go //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa'i gnas skabs bar ma gsum po dag go //
translated: These are the three intermediate states of instruction in the treatise Establishing Perception-Only.

original: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs ni ma gtogs te mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs ni ma gtogs te mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of no more learning is not included because it is without formation.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: This is also divided into three.

original: bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa dang / ngas de dag gi phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par gsungs pa yin par bstan pa dang / de dag gis chos de thos nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa dang / ngas de dag gi phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par gsungs pa yin par bstan pa dang / de dag gis chos de thos nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the intention of the teaching, and the explanation of the correct teaching in accordance with their aspirations, beginning with ‚Äúfor their sake,‚Äù and the explanation of the benefits of the teaching of the Dharma, beginning with ‚Äúhaving heard that Dharma from them.‚Äù

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: dgongs pa de la yang gnas skabs rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: dgongs pa de la yang gnas skabs rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: That intention also has five aspects.

original: dang po dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is the stage of generating the roots of virtue, which is as follows:

original: dad pa bcu'i mdun rol du rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa bcu'i mdun rol du rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The generation of the roots of virtue of the side of liberation in the presence of the ten faiths.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i chos ni dge bsnyen gyi tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i chos ni dge bsnyen gyi tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma of generating the roots of virtue of the side of liberation should be understood as taught in the S≈´tra on the Precepts of the Lay Practitioner.

original: gnyis pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the stage of purification, which is as follows:

original: dad pa bcu po rnams te 'di ltar ci nus ci lcogs kyis sdig pa'i las rnams sbyang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa bcu po rnams te 'di ltar ci nus ci lcogs kyis sdig pa'i las rnams sbyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ten kinds of faith, because one purifies evil actions to the best of one's ability.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning states:

original: sdig pa'i las yongs su ma dag pa rnams sdig pa'i las rnams yongs su dag par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las yongs su ma dag pa rnams sdig pa'i las rnams yongs su dag par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those whose evil actions are not purified purify their evil actions.üîΩAnd the Sutra on the Support of Mindfulness states:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo las kyang chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir sdig pa'i las mi byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo las kyang chos 'di pa'i so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir sdig pa'i las mi byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because they abandon the ignorance that is not shared by ordinary beings, they do not engage in evil actions.

original: gsum pa rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the stage of ripening the mindstream, which is as follows:

original: shes pa bcu'i gang zag mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pas rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa bcu'i gang zag mngon par yid ches pa la sogs pas rgyud yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The ten kinds of knowledge, because they ripen the mindstream through such things as generating faith.

original: de'i @3a * //
analyzed: de'i @3a * //
translated: The fourth is the stage of the result, which is as follows:üîΩThe ten kinds of correct abandonment, because they are the result of the path.

original: phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: de la brten nas dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la brten nas dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of that, the roots of virtue are brought to full maturity.

original: bzhi pa mos pa mang du bsgom pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa mos pa mang du bsgom pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth is the situation of cultivating a lot of interest.

original: spyod pa rnam pa bcu la gnas pa dag la nges pa'i mos pa mang du mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa bcu la gnas pa dag la nges pa'i mos pa mang du mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the situation of those who abide in the ten kinds of deeds and have a lot of manifest interest in them.

original: lnga pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs ni yongs su bsngo ba rnam pa bcu la gnas pa dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i gnas skabs ni yongs su bsngo ba rnam pa bcu la gnas pa dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fifth is the situation of gathering the accumulations of merit and sublime wisdom. It is the situation of those who abide in the ten kinds of dedications and have perfected the two kinds of accumulations of merit and sublime wisdom.

original: de ni 'di skad du dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa gang yin pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas tshogs ma rdzogs pa gang yin pa de dag tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bar gyi phyir de dag la skye ba ngo bo nyid
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa gang yin pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas tshogs ma rdzogs pa gang yin pa de dag tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i bar gyi phyir de dag la skye ba ngo bo nyid
translated: That is to say, for those who have not generated the roots of virtue, they generate the roots of virtue, and for those who have not completed the accumulations, they complete the accumulations.üîΩüîΩ

original: med pa bstan pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa bstan pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is to say, it is taught that the non-arising of those who have not generated the roots of virtue is taught to be the nature of those who have generated the roots of virtue, and so on up to the non-arising of those who have not completed the accumulations is taught to be the nature of those who have completed the accumulations.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na tshigs kyi gnas skabs kyi dngos po lnga'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na tshigs kyi gnas skabs kyi dngos po lnga'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Another way of explaining this is that it distinguishes the five states of beings,

original: gnas skabs rnam par lnga rnam par gzhag nas sems bzhi bcu dang sbyar ba ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: gnas skabs rnam par lnga rnam par gzhag nas sems bzhi bcu dang sbyar ba ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: but it does not posit forty minds based on those five states.

original: dngos po lnga'i bye brag ni gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po lnga'i bye brag ni gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The distinction of the five states is as explained above.

original: ngas de dag gi phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par chos gsungs pa yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngas de dag gi phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par chos gsungs pa yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second, the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the inclinations of the disciples.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams dang po nyid nas chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rigs pa khong du ma chud pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi rgyu med pa dang / bdag nyid kyi skye bar 'dzin pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos thams cad ni rgyu las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams dang po nyid nas chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rigs pa khong du ma chud pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi rgyu med pa dang / bdag nyid kyi skye bar 'dzin pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos thams cad ni rgyu las skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, since sentient beings, from the very beginning, do not understand the principle of dependent origination of phenomena, they grasp at the non-existent cause of mind and the intrinsic reality of self. Therefore, the Lord taught beginning with the lack of intrinsic reality of arising, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are born from causes.

original: bdag nyid las ni ma yin no zhes bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid las ni ma yin no zhes bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are not born from themselves.‚Äù This is the meaning.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed la ci nus kyis mi rtag pa nyid du shes shing mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can du shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan @3b yon ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed la ci nus kyis mi rtag pa nyid du shes shing mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can du shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan @3b yon ston to //
translated: The third, the teaching of the benefits of teaching the Dharma, is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚Äúhaving understood thus,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di yang phan yon rnam pa bzhi yod pas de nyid las rnam par bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang phan yon rnam pa bzhi yod pas de nyid las rnam par bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This also has four benefits, so it is divided into four parts.

original: mi rtag pa nyid khong du chud pa'i phan yon dang / sdangs shing shin tu skyo ba'i phan yon dang / sdig pa las bzlog nas dge ba spyod pa'i phan yon dang / dngos po lnga phun sum tshogs pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid khong du chud pa'i phan yon dang / sdangs shing shin tu skyo ba'i phan yon dang / sdig pa las bzlog nas dge ba spyod pa'i phan yon dang / dngos po lnga phun sum tshogs pa'i phan yon no //
translated: The benefit of understanding impermanence, the benefit of being frightened and greatly distressed, the benefit of turning away from evil and practicing virtue, and the benefit of perfecting the five things.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas rga shi'i bar gang yin pa de dag ni dbang phyug la sogs pa las byung ba ma yin par gsungs pa nyid kyis sems can rnams ci nus ci lcogs kyis chos rnams
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas rga shi'i bar gang yin pa de dag ni dbang phyug la sogs pa las byung ba ma yin par gsungs pa nyid kyis sems can rnams ci nus ci lcogs kyis chos rnams
translated: Thus the Lord has said that the formations due to the condition of ignorance up to aging and death do not arise from a divine creator, etc.

original: mi rtag cing mi brtan pa nyid ni mi rtag pa yin par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag cing mi brtan pa nyid ni mi rtag pa yin par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the impermanence of the world, sentient beings understand that phenomena are impermanent and unstable.üîΩMoreover, because of the instability of the world, one understands that compounded phenomena are subject to change, since they do not remain as they are, like nirvana, free from arising and cessation.

original: gzhan yang yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa ltar skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang bral ba'i phyir brtan pa nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'dus byas rnams ni snga ma 'gags nas phyi ma skye bas rim gyis nyams shing 'jig par 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yin par shes par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa ltar skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang bral ba'i phyir brtan pa nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang 'dus byas rnams ni snga ma 'gags nas phyi ma skye bas rim gyis nyams shing 'jig par 'gyur bas 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yin par shes par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Moreover, one understands that compounded phenomena are subject to change because they gradually deteriorate and perish, since the later arises from the cessation of the former.

original: 'du byed thams cad la yid dngang bar byed shin tu skyo bar byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dngangs shing shin tu skyo bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la yid dngang bar byed shin tu skyo bar byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dngangs shing shin tu skyo bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: One becomes frightened and thoroughly disgusted with all compounded things. This is the second benefit, the benefit of becoming frightened and thoroughly disgusted.

original: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning is self-evident from the sutra itself.

original: yid dang nga bar byas shin tu skyo bar byas nas sdig pa rnams las bzlog ste /
analyzed: yid dang nga bar byas shin tu skyo bar byas nas sdig pa rnams las bzlog ste /
translated: Having become frightened and thoroughly disgusted, one turns away from evil.

original: sdig pa'i chos gang yin pa mi byed cing dge ba'i chos rnams brtson 'grus kyis brten par byed do zhes bya ba ni gsum pa sdig pa las bzlog nas dge ba spyod pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos gang yin pa mi byed cing dge ba'i chos rnams brtson 'grus kyis brten par byed do zhes bya ba ni gsum pa sdig pa las bzlog nas dge ba spyod pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: One does not perform any evil dharmas and one practices the good dharmas with vigor. This is the third benefit, the benefit of turning away from evil and practicing the good.

original: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //üîΩdge ba la brten pa'i rgyus dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed do //üîΩsgrib pa yongs su ma byang ba rnams kyang yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do // dge ba la brten pa'i rgyus dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed do // sgrib pa yongs su ma byang ba rnams kyang yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: The meaning is self-evident from the sutra itself.üîΩBy the cause of practicing the good, one generates the roots of virtue that have not yet been generated.üîΩOne purifies the obscurations that have not yet been purified.

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa yang yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa yang yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: One brings to maturity the continuum that has not yet matured.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des na mos pa mang du bsgom zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang mang du bsags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dngos po lnga phun sum tshogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des na mos pa mang du bsgom zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis kyang mang du bsags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dngos po lnga phun sum tshogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: By that cause and condition, they cultivate much interest and also gather the two collections of merit and wisdom.

original: dngos po lnga rnam par bshad pa ni sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po lnga rnam par bshad pa ni sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the five things should be understood as above.

original: @4a * // de dag de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis bsags pa'i bar du 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: @4a * // de dag de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis bsags pa'i bar du 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Although they generate the roots of virtue in that way up to gathering the two collections of merit and wisdom,

original: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyi ma bstanüîΩpa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyi ma bstan pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: However, not knowing the lack of entityness of production and the two types of lack of entityness of characteristic and ultimate just as it is, from here on he teaches the latter lack of entityness, beginning with the topic of the occasion of application.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three:

original: bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa dang ; de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la zhes bya ba man chad kyis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa bstan pa dang / de dag gis chos de thos nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis bstan pa gsungs pa phan yon bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa dang ; de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la zhes bya ba man chad kyis mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa bstan pa dang / de dag gis chos de thos nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis bstan pa gsungs pa phan yon bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the teaching of the intention of the statement, the teaching of the correct explanation in accordance with the inclination and the teaching of the benefit of the statement of the teaching from ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata taught them the Dharma‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe Dharma of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.‚Äù

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into two:

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis mi shes par bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa mi shes pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //üîΩ'di ltar sems can rnams chos rnams ni rkyen las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis mi shes par bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa mi shes pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o // 'di ltar sems can rnams chos rnams ni rkyen las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: This is the first.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pas bskyed pa ma yin par bstan par thos pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don khong du chud nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa sogs par byed kyang 'dus byas kyi 'du byed rnams sgyu
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pas bskyed pa ma yin par bstan par thos pa'i dbang gis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don khong du chud nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa sogs par byed kyang 'dus byas kyi 'du byed rnams sgyu
translated: Thus, through the power of hearing the teaching that phenomena arise from conditions and not from ƒ™≈õvara and so on, sentient beings understand the meaning of impermanence and so on and they accumulate the two kinds of collections of merit and wisdom.

original: ma la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag par yod pa ma yin par shes pas chos rnams la yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen nas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid khong du mi chud pa'am yang gong du bstan pa lta bu'i don
analyzed: ma la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag par yod pa ma yin par shes pas chos rnams la yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen nas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid khong du mi chud pa'am yang gong du bstan pa lta bu'i don
translated: But because they understand that compounded things are like illusions and so on and are not real, they do not understand the realitylessness of character, or else they do not understand the meaning of the teaching as it was explained above.

original: dam pa ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam pa ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one does not understand the two kinds of reality of the ultimate.

original: 'du byed thams cad las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not become truly disenchanted with all compounded things.

original: yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: One does not become truly free from attachment.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: One does not become truly liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: One is not liberated from the defilement of the afflictions.

original: las kyi kun nas @4b nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas @4b nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: One is not liberated from the defilement of karma.üîΩOne is not liberated from the defilement of birth.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang yongs su grol par mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ngo bo nyid med pa mi shes pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang yongs su grol par mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ngo bo nyid med pa mi shes pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o /
translated: This is the second teaching on the disadvantage of not understanding the three kinds of naturelessness.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of not understanding the three kinds of naturelessness,

original: 'du byed thams cad la yang dag par skyo ba sogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la yang dag par skyo ba sogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and he does not become truly disenchanted with all conditioned things.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skyo ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du skyo ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: Here, ‚Äútrue disenchantment‚Äù refers to the path of application.

original: yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni par chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni par chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúTrue freedom from passion‚Äù refers to the uninterrupted path.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol ba la sogs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol ba la sogs pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúTrue liberation‚Äù and so on refer to the path of liberation and the distinctive path.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of afflictions‚Äîafflictions of passion, afflictions of action, and afflictions of birth‚Äîshould be understood as they are explained in the treatises, the Compendium of the Great Vehicle and the Establishment of Authority.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la yang chos ston par mdzad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag la yang chos ston par mdzad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata also teaches the Dharma to those who are in the hells, and so on.

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis pa mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba man chad ni gnyis pa mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe lack of nature in terms of characteristics and the lack of nature in terms of the ultimate‚Äù teaches the second, the correct explanation in accordance with their interests.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te bstan pa nyid yang dag par bshad pa bstan pa dang / bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te bstan pa nyid yang dag par bshad pa bstan pa dang / bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is also twofold: the teaching of the correct explanation of the teaching and the teaching of the intention of the teaching.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba bcu la gnas pa dag sbyor ba la sogs pa bsgom pa rnams bstan pa 'di thos par 'os pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su bsngo ba bcu la gnas pa dag sbyor ba la sogs pa bsgom pa rnams bstan pa 'di thos par 'os pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that since those who abide in the ten dedications are worthy of hearing the teachings on the meditations of the stages of practice and so on, they are taught.

original: 'di ltar de dag 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dang / yang dag par rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar bya ba'i phyir dang / yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dang / yang dag par rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to quickly accomplish the path of application and so on, and in order to quickly accomplish the result of the path of application and so on,üîΩthe bodhisattvas teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the intention of the teaching.

original: 'di ltar sbyong ba la sogs pa la gnas pa dag dang sbyor ba la sogs pa'i lam myur du 'grub pa dang / @5a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyong ba la sogs pa la gnas pa dag dang sbyor ba la sogs pa'i lam myur du 'grub pa dang / @5a * //
translated: Thus, those who abide in training and so on quickly accomplish the path of application and so on,üîΩand they quickly accomplish the result of the path of application and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po dag las 'da' ba'i ched du de'i phyir yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po dag las 'da' ba'i ched du de'i phyir yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the two kinds of realitylessness are taught for the purpose of transcending the three kinds of addictions.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag par mos par byed //
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag par mos par byed //
translated: Having heard that teaching, they believe in the realitylessness of production, and in the realitylessness of specific character, and in the ultimate realitylessness.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed par sems par byed /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed par sems par byed /
translated: They think of it as being thoroughly discriminated.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog par byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog par byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa bstan pa gsungs pa'i phan yon ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey think of it as being thoroughly discriminated‚Äù and so on teaches the benefit of the third teaching.

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la gnas pas 'thob pa'i phan yon bstan pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang la zhes bya ba man chad kyis sa la gnas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis kyi phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la gnas pas 'thob pa'i phan yon bstan pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang la zhes bya ba man chad kyis sa la gnas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis kyi phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefit of attainment is taught in the context of the stage of application, and the benefit of the two kinds of stages is taught in the context of the stage of the other-dependent.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: sbyor ba la gnas pas 'thob pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la gnas pas 'thob pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of abiding in preparation.

original: sbyor ba la gnas pa de yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: sbyor ba la gnas pa de yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: Abiding in preparation is explained differently.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni bskal ba grangs med pa gnyis par gtogs pas rab tu dga' ba'i nye ba'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi lcogs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsam gtan dang por gtogs pa lta bu'o zhe'o /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni bskal ba grangs med pa gnyis par gtogs pas rab tu dga' ba'i nye ba'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi lcogs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsam gtan dang por gtogs pa lta bu'o zhe'o /
translated: Some say: It belongs to the second incalculable eon because it is the preparation for the Joyful level.

original: kha cig na re yongs su bsngo ba bcu la gnas pa yin pas bskal ba grangs med pa dang por gtogs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re yongs su bsngo ba bcu la gnas pa yin pas bskal ba grangs med pa dang por gtogs te /
translated: Some say: It belongs to the first incalculable eon because it abides in the ten dedications.

original: da dungs lam zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: da dungs lam zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: It is the path of entry to the first incalculable eon.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although these two explanations exist,

original: slob dpon chos skyong ni bshad pa snga ma ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong ni bshad pa snga ma ltar 'dod de /
translated: master Dharmashri asserts the former explanation.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
translated: The treatise Establishing Cognition Only states:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang nye ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i ming rnam par gzhag pa yin te //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang nye ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i ming rnam par gzhag pa yin te //
translated: It is posited as preparation because it is close to the path of seeing.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained.

original: gnas skabs 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa phyi ma gnyis bshad pa'i bstan pa thos pa'i phyir yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa bzhi'i rnal 'byor sgom pas dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi spong la /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa phyi ma gnyis bshad pa'i bstan pa thos pa'i phyir yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa bzhi'i rnal 'byor sgom pas dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi spong la /
translated: In this context, the four kinds of thorough searching and the four kinds of yoga of understanding reality as it is are taught in order to explain the latter two kinds of realitylessness. The consciousness that has an objective reference does not eliminate the imagined pattern, but

original: gzung ba ni stong ba nyid du rtogs nas rab tu sel bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba ni stong ba nyid du rtogs nas rab tu sel bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
translated: the consciousness that has no objective reference does eliminate it. The elimination of the objective reference is the realitylessness of the pattern of signs.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa des rab tu phye ba'i don dam pa yin pa de ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa des rab tu phye ba'i don dam pa yin pa de ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The ultimate reality that is revealed by that realitylessness is called the realitylessness of the ultimate.

original: rgya cher rnam @5b par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam @5b par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the teaching in the treatise, the Establishment of the Theory of Consciousness Only.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gnyis rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gnyis rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: Therefore, here the two kinds of realitylessness are analyzed.

original: sems par byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni yongs su tshol ba bzhi po nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: sems par byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni yongs su tshol ba bzhi po nyid la bya'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone reflects‚Äù refers to the four investigations themselves.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed ces gsungs pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po dag nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed ces gsungs pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po dag nyid do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone realizes in accordance with reality‚Äù refers to the four thorough knowledges of reality as it is.

original: gzhan yang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / sems par byed pa ni yongs su tshol ba bzhi'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / sems par byed pa ni yongs su tshol ba bzhi'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Moreover, the thorough differentiation and the reflection are the states of the four investigations.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa ni sa dang po yan chad rab tu rtogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa ni sa dang po yan chad rab tu rtogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The realization in accordance with reality is the state of thorough realization beginning with the first spiritual level.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed de zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sa la gnas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis kyi phan yon zhes bya ba ston to
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed de zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sa la gnas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis kyi phan yon zhes bya ba ston to
translated: The statement ‚Äúone does not settle down in the imagined reality as the characteristic of the other-dependent reality‚Äù teaches the benefit of the two aspects of the state of the second spiritual level.

original: // 'di yang phan yon rnam pa drug yod pa nyid kyis rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: // 'di yang phan yon rnam pa drug yod pa nyid kyis rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: This also is divided into six aspects by virtue of the six kinds of benefit.

original: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu sel ba dang / rgyu rnam pa gsum mi skyed pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang 'gog pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu spong ba dang / lam rnam pa gsum rab tu 'dren pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu sel ba dang / rgyu rnam pa gsum mi skyed pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang 'gog pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu spong ba dang / lam rnam pa gsum rab tu 'dren pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'o //
translated: The elimination of the imagined identity, the non-generation of the three kinds of causes, the cessation of the relative, the abandonment of the cause of the future, the guidance in the three paths, and the freedom from the three kinds of afflictions.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /

translated: Just as some, having heard about emptiness and selflessness, deny all correct reasoning about causes and effects, saying, ‚ÄúPhenomena do not exist,‚Äù and sever all their roots of virtue,

original: byed pa rang gi lta ba nyes pa dang bcas pa de dag stong ba nyid dang / bdag med pa'i nyes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byed pa rang gi lta ba nyes pa dang bcas pa de dag stong ba nyid dang / bdag med pa'i nyes pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that the fault of emptiness and selflessness lies with those who have the fault of their own bad views?

original: stong ba nyid la log par bzung ba'i bdag gis yang dag pa ma yin pas log par lta ba bskyed nas nyes par spyod pa byas pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i don ni sems dang / tshig gis dpag par mi nus te /
analyzed: stong ba nyid la log par bzung ba'i bdag gis yang dag pa ma yin pas log par lta ba bskyed nas nyes par spyod pa byas pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i don ni sems dang / tshig gis dpag par mi nus te /
translated: of those who, due to the self‚Äôs distorted apprehension of emptiness, have generated wrong views and engaged in negative conduct.

original: de bdag gis 'thob par 'gyur ba ma yin pas so so'i skye bo dag chos rnams stong ba'o zhes thos nas 'phags pa'i dgongs pa ma shes nas kun rdzob tsam du yod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs shing dge ba'i chos rnams 'jig par byed
analyzed: de bdag gis 'thob par 'gyur ba ma yin pas so so'i skye bo dag chos rnams stong ba'o zhes thos nas 'phags pa'i dgongs pa ma shes nas kun rdzob tsam du yod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs shing dge ba'i chos rnams 'jig par byed
translated: Since they will not attain it, when ordinary beings hear that phenomena are empty, they do not understand the intention of the noble ones and deny mere relative causes and results. They destroy virtuous qualities.

original: pa de ci stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i nyes pa yin nam /
analyzed: pa de ci stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i nyes pa yin nam /
translated: Is this the fault of emptiness and selflessness?

original: 'phags pa rnams stong pa nyid kyi gsungs pa bstan pa la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams stong pa nyid kyi gsungs pa bstan pa la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the intention of the noble ones in teaching emptiness?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa rab tu bstsal ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa rab tu bstsal ba'i phyir ro /
translated: It is to dispel the apprehension of the existence of unreal thoughts.

original: gal te de lta na chos rnams kyang gsungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na chos rnams kyang gsungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the teachings would be just that,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas chos rnams stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa rab tu bstsal pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas chos rnams stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa rab tu bstsal pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the TathƒÅgata taught that phenomena are empty in order to eliminate the grasping of phenomena as real.

original: yang dag par na gang dag chos rnams stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i ched du de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnams yod pa nyid du yang gsung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par na gang dag chos rnams stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i ched du de bzhin gshegs pas chos rnams yod pa nyid du yang gsung bar mdzad do //
translated: In reality, the TathƒÅgata taught that phenomena exist in order to eliminate the grasping of phenomena as empty.

original: gal te 'dzin pa btsal ba'i ched du yod par gsungs /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin pa btsal ba'i ched du yod par gsungs /
translated: If he taught existence in order to eliminate grasping,

original: stong pa nyid du yang gsungs pa yin na /üîΩchos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i don de stong pa zhig gam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du yang gsungs pa yin na / chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i don de stong pa zhig gam /
translated: then he also taught emptiness.

original: 'on te yod pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Is the reality of phenomena empty or is it existent?

original: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin /
translated: The reality of phenomena is not existent

original: stong pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not empty.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dag gis 'thob par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dag gis 'thob par mi nus pas so //
translated: It cannot be attained by conceptual elaborations.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pas gsungs pa dag brdzun pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pas gsungs pa dag brdzun pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the teachings of the noble ones not false?

original: log par zin pa rab tu sel ba'i phyir brdzun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: log par zin pa rab tu sel ba'i phyir brdzun pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not false because it completely eliminates wrong understanding.

original: stong pa dang yod pa'i bstan pa gnyis ka yang 'dzin pa rab tu sel ba yin na /
analyzed: stong pa dang yod pa'i bstan pa gnyis ka yang 'dzin pa rab tu sel ba yin na /
translated: Both the teaching of emptiness and the teaching of existence eliminate grasping.

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas phal cher stong ba nyid kyi bstan pa gsung bar mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas phal cher stong ba nyid kyi bstan pa gsung bar mdzad /
translated: Why did the TathƒÅgata teach the doctrine of emptiness so often?

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams phal che ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing 'khor ba yang phal cher yod par 'dzin pa las 'byung bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams phal che ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing 'khor ba yang phal cher yod par 'dzin pa las 'byung bas /
translated: Because most sentient beings grasp things as existent, and most of cyclic existence arises from the conception of existence.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas yod pa nyid du @37b 'dzin pa rab tu bsal ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal spang ba'i ched du stong pa nyid kyi bstan pa phal cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas yod pa nyid du @37b 'dzin pa rab tu bsal ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal spang ba'i ched du stong pa nyid kyi bstan pa phal cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the conception of existence and abandon the suffering of cyclic existence, the TathƒÅgata taught the doctrine of emptiness most often.

original: gal te stong pa nyid dang yod pa gnyi ga yang bstan pa'i sgo yin na /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid dang yod pa gnyi ga yang bstan pa'i sgo yin na /
translated: If both the teaching of emptiness and the teaching of existence are doors to the teaching,

original: ci'i phyir sngar stong pa nyid yang dag pa'i don yin zhes bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sngar stong pa nyid yang dag pa'i don yin zhes bstan ce na /
translated: why was it previously taught that emptiness is the meaning of reality?

original: thabs kyis brtags pa tsam du bstan pa yin pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: thabs kyis brtags pa tsam du bstan pa yin pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since it is taught that the self is merely an imputation by means of the method of reasoning, there is no contradiction between the two.

original: gzhan yang stong pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni ma yin pa dgag cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang stong pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni ma yin pa dgag cing /
translated: Moreover, the word ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is a negation that refutes nonexistence.

original: ma yin pa nyid du ston pas stong pa nyid yod pa kho na ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid du ston pas stong pa nyid yod pa kho na ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it teaches nonexistence, emptiness does not exist.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yod de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yod de /
translated: However, emptiness does exist.

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i sems can thams cad sel cing chos rnams thams cad yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i sems can thams cad sel cing chos rnams thams cad yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is emptiness that eliminates all beings who grasp and all phenomena that are grasped.

original: stong pa nyid kyang ma yin pa mthar thug pa yang dag pa'i don rtogs par byed kyang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang ma yin pa mthar thug pa yang dag pa'i don rtogs par byed kyang /
translated: It is emptiness that causes the realization of the ultimate, authentic meaning.

original: chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi don ni yang dag par na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi don ni yang dag par na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: However, the meaning of the suchness of phenomena is not, in reality, the nature of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid sgor gyur ba'i phyir brtags pa tsam du stong pa nyid ces bstan pas de kho na nyid kyi don ni stong ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgor gyur ba'i phyir brtags pa tsam du stong pa nyid ces bstan pas de kho na nyid kyi don ni stong ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is the gateway, it is taught that it is merely an imputation, ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù Therefore, the meaning of suchness is not emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid sgor gyur ba yang de kho na nyid kyi don ni yod pa ma yin pas yod pa'i sgor 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgor gyur ba yang de kho na nyid kyi don ni yod pa ma yin pas yod pa'i sgor 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that since the meaning of thatness does not exist, it is logical that it is the door of existence,üîΩthen since it is explained that the door is in accordance with the sense faculties, there is no fault in taking it to be existence.

original: dbang po'i rjes su sgo zhes bshad pa yin pas yod pa nyid la bya na yang nyes pa med kyang sgo'i don ni stong pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pas yod pa yod ces bya ba thams cad ni mngon par zhen pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su sgo zhes bshad pa yin pas yod pa nyid la bya na yang nyes pa med kyang sgo'i don ni stong pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pas yod pa yod ces bya ba thams cad ni mngon par zhen pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba
translated: However, since the meaning of door is in accordance with emptiness, all statements of existence exist in accordance with the mind that conceives of them.üîΩAll statements of emptiness are in accordance with the mind that conceives of them.

original: yin la / stong pa stong pa zhes bya ba thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa dag rab tu sel bas de lta bas na blo dang ldan pa dag ni stong pa zhes bya ba'i tshig thos nas yang yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa thams cadüîΩdang bral bas chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: yin la / stong pa stong pa zhes bya ba thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa dag rab tu sel bas de lta bas na blo dang ldan pa dag ni stong pa zhes bya ba'i tshig thos nas yang yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral bas chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, when the wise hear the word emptiness, they are free from all conceptions of existence and nonexistence and

original: med pa yang ma yin pa khong du chud de /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa khong du chud de /
translated: understand that the meaning of the reality of phenomena is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa skyed par mi byed do zhes ston to //üîΩstong pa nyid la log par bzung ba'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa skyed par mi byed do zhes ston to // stong pa nyid la log par bzung ba'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: It does not generate the conceptual elaborations of the notions of existence and nonexistence.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The defining characteristics of the disadvantages of misapprehending emptiness are as they are presented in the Levels of Yogic Deeds:

original: de nyid las kha cig shes par dka' ba'i mdo sde theg pa chen po dang ldan pa zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa dgongs pa'i don bstan pa dag thos na /
analyzed: de nyid las kha cig shes par dka' ba'i mdo sde theg pa chen po dang ldan pa zab mo stong pa nyid dang ldan pa dgongs pa'i don bstan pa dag thos na /
translated: In this regard, some people hear the discourses of the Great Vehicle that are difficult to understand and that contain the profound doctrine of emptiness.üîΩNot understanding the meaning of the explanations correctly, they improperly analyze them.

original: @38a * // bshad pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes nas tshul bzhin ma yin par brtags te rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i rtog ge tsam gyis 'di dag thams cad ni brtags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: @38a * // bshad pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes nas tshul bzhin ma yin par brtags te rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i rtog ge tsam gyis 'di dag thams cad ni brtags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Through mere speculation, which is not based on reasoning, they think, ‚ÄúAll of these are mere imputations.

original: 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is the only truth.

original: su 'di ltar lta ba de ni yang dag par lta ba yin no zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
analyzed: su 'di ltar lta ba de ni yang dag par lta ba yin no zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra'o //
translated: Those who view things in this way are the ones who have the correct view.‚Äù

original: de dag gi ltar na 'dogs pa'i gzhi'i dngos po tsam yang med pas 'dogs pa de nyid kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur na brtags pa tsam gyi kho na lta yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na 'dogs pa'i gzhi'i dngos po tsam yang med pas 'dogs pa de nyid kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur na brtags pa tsam gyi kho na lta yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Since, according to them, not even the mere thing that is the basis of designation exists, even that designation itself would not exist in any way at all. How could it be that it exists only as a mere imputation?

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs des na de dag gis de kho na dang / brtags pa de kho na la yang skur ba btab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs des na de dag gis de kho na dang / brtags pa de kho na la yang skur ba btab par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, by this method, they also deprecate reality and the reality of imputation.

original: brtags pa dang de kho na la skur ba btab pas na med par lta ba'i gtso bo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang de kho na la skur ba btab pas na med par lta ba'i gtso bo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since they deprecate imputation and reality, they should be known as the chief nihilists.

original: de ltar med pa ba de ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mdzad sa pa rnams kyis smos pa'i 'os ma yin pa dang / 'grogs par mi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar med pa ba de ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mdzad sa pa rnams kyis smos pa'i 'os ma yin pa dang / 'grogs par mi bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, those nihilists are not worthy of being mentioned by those who practice pure conduct, nor are they to be associated with.

original: de ni bdag nyid kyang phung bar byed la /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid kyang phung bar byed la /
translated: They destroy themselves,

original: 'jig rten gang de'i lta ba la phyogs pa yang phung bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gang de'i lta ba la phyogs pa yang phung bar byed do //
translated: and they also destroy the world that is oriented toward their view.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di la dgongs nas 'di na la la gang zag tu lta ba ni bla'i /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di la dgongs nas 'di na la la gang zag tu lta ba ni bla'i /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, thinking of this, said, ‚ÄúIt is better to be one who has the view of the personüîΩthan to have the view of nihilism.

original: la la stong ba nyid la log par zin pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: la la stong ba nyid la log par zin pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord, thinking of this, said, ‚ÄúIt is better for someone to hold the view of the real person than for someone to grasp emptiness wrongly.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang zag tu lta ba can gyi skye bo ni shes bya la rmongs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba can gyi skye bo ni shes bya la rmongs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: People who hold the view of the real person are only confused about knowable objects.

original: shes bya thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not deny all knowable objects.

original: gzhi des na sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhi des na sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because of that, they are not reborn as hell beings.

original: gzhan yang chos 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal rnams las thar bar 'dod pa dag kyang phung bar byed cing slu bar mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal rnams las thar bar 'dod pa dag kyang phung bar byed cing slu bar mi byed la /
translated: Moreover, they do not deceive or mislead those who seek the Dharma and who seek to be free from suffering.

original: chos dang bde ba la yang 'god par byed do //
analyzed: chos dang bde ba la yang 'god par byed do //
translated: They establish them in the Dharma and in happiness.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi dag la yang g-yel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi dag la yang g-yel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not neglect the bases of training.

original: stong pa nyid la log par zin pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la yang rmongs la shes bya thams cad la yang skur ba 'debs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la log par zin pa ni shes bya'i dngos po la yang rmongs la shes bya thams cad la yang skur ba 'debs te /
translated: One who wrongly grasps emptiness is confused about the things that are objects of knowledge and also deprecates all objects of knowledge.

original: gzhi des sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhi des sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: On that basis, one is born in the hells.

original: gzhan yang chos 'dod pa dang sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par 'dod pa rnams kyang phung bar byed do /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos 'dod pa dang sdug bsngal las rnam par thar par 'dod pa rnams kyang phung bar byed do /
translated: Moreover, one also destroys those who desire the Dharma and who desire liberation from suffering.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la yang g-yel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la yang g-yel bar 'gyur te /
translated: One also neglects those bases of training.

original: de ltar yang @38b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi dngos po la skur ba 'debs pa ni chos 'dul ba 'di las rab tu nyams pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩbstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar yang @38b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi dngos po la skur ba 'debs pa ni chos 'dul ba 'di las rab tu nyams pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // bstan bcos shin tu rgyas pa brgya pa las kyang /
translated: Thus, one who deprecates things as they really are is a great transgressor in this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: Also, the Hundred Thousand Perfection of Wisdom Treatise explains in accordance with the teaching in the Levels of Yogic Deeds:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, the same text says:

original: gzhan yang shes rab zhan pa dag gi mdun du stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i don brjod na lta ba ngan pa 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab zhan pa dag gi mdun du stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'i don brjod na lta ba ngan pa 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the meaning of emptiness and selflessness is expressed in the presence of those with weak intelligence, bad views increase.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: The Verses of S≈´tra say:

original: de yis bdag tu 'dzin pa bskyed sla yi //
analyzed: de yis bdag tu 'dzin pa bskyed sla yi //
translated: It is easy for them to generate the apprehension of a self,

original: stong dang bdag med lta ba de lta min //
analyzed: stong dang bdag med lta ba de lta min //
translated: but not the view of emptiness and selflessness.

original: de na ngan 'gro dag la gzhol ba'ang yin //
analyzed: de na ngan 'gro dag la gzhol ba'ang yin //
translated: They are also headed toward the lower realms,

original: dang po mya ngan 'das la rgyab kyis phyogs //üîΩzhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dang po mya ngan 'das la rgyab kyis phyogs // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and at first they turn their back on nirvana.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The Commentary to this says:

original: de'i bya ba ni 'jig rten na shes rab zhan pa gang yin pa dag go /üîΩbdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni 'jig rten na shes rab zhan pa gang yin pa dag go / bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir action‚Äù refers to those in the world who have weak intelligence.üîΩ‚ÄúThe apprehension of a self‚Äù refers to the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag gir lta ba de yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bcas pa dang / de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis lta ba de yang bsdus so //
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba de yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bcas pa dang / de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis lta ba de yang bsdus so //
translated: The view of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is also included in the phrase ‚Äúthe apprehension of a self‚Äù because it is associated with the apprehension of a self.

analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, the grasping of a self is not in accord with correct reasoning.

original: de 'byung ba ni sla ste /
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni sla ste /
translated: But it is easy to arise,

original: nyes dmigs yang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes dmigs yang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its disadvantages are slight.

original: yang na bskal ba grangs med pa gsum pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na bskal ba grangs med pa gsum pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir /
