original: ming 'di gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ming 'di gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These three terms are stated.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis deng 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa bdag nyid kyis khong du chud par gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis deng 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa bdag nyid kyis khong du chud par gyur pa ston to //
translated: As it is said, Thus, as I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said here, and so on, this shows the second, his own understanding.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two aspects:

original: phung po la sogs pa sgo lnga po dag thugs su chud nas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gsungs par bstan pa dang / bden pa la sogs pa'i sgo gnyis po dag thugs su chud nas ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum gsungs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa sgo lnga po dag thugs su chud nas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum gsungs par bstan pa dang / bden pa la sogs pa'i sgo gnyis po dag thugs su chud nas ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum gsungs par bstan pa'o //
translated: Having understood the five doors such as the aggregates, he taught the three natures. Having understood the two doors such as the truths, he taught the three non-natures.

original: dang po yang gnyis kyis bstan to /üîΩgzugs las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid @48a * //
analyzed: dang po yang gnyis kyis bstan to / gzugs las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid @48a * //
translated: The first is also taught in two parts.

original: med pa rnam pa gsum gsungs par bstan pa dang / zlas phung po gzhan la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med pa rnam pa gsum gsungs par bstan pa dang / zlas phung po gzhan la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the three non-natures beginning with form, and the teaching on the other aggregates and so on.

original: gzugs kyi phung po las brtsams pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po las brtsams pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The teaching on the aggregate of form is also divided into two parts.

original: ngo bo nyid snga ma gnyis khong du chud par bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid gsum pa khong du chud par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid snga ma gnyis khong du chud par bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid gsum pa khong du chud par bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on understanding the first two natures, and the teaching on understanding the third nature.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold.

original: khong du chud par gyur ba mdor bstan pa dang / khong du chud pa rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: khong du chud par gyur ba mdor bstan pa dang / khong du chud pa rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
translated: The brief teaching on what is to be understood, and the explanation by analyzing what is to be understood.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dag la gzugs kyi phung po zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o // rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dag la gzugs kyi phung po zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: This is the first.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du mid dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po skye'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du mid dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po skye'o zhe 'am /
translated: The imagined characteristic is the establishment of names and conventions as the characteristic of the essential nature or the specific characteristic of the signs of compounded phenomena, which are the basis of the imagined characteristic, the sphere of conceptual thought.üîΩThe establishment of names and conventions as the characteristic of the essential nature or the specific characteristic, such as ‚Äúthe form aggregate,‚Äù ‚Äúthe form aggregate arises,‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po 'gag go zhe 'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po 'gag go zhe 'am /
translated: ‚Äúthe form aggregate ceases,‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po gtan du spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa'o zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa khong du chud par gyurüîΩba rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po gtan du spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa'o zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa khong du chud par gyur ba rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe complete abandonment of the form aggregate,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe complete understanding of the form aggregate,‚Äù is the imagined characteristic.üîΩThis is the second.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the defining characteristics of the imputed, and the teaching on the nature of the dependent.

original: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The teaching on the defining characteristics of the imputed is also divided into two parts:

original: gzhan la brtan nas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag par bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das de la brten nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med par gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la brtan nas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag par bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das de la brten nas zhes bya ba man chad kyis kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med par gsungs pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching on the presentation of the nature of the imputed in dependence on others, and the teaching on the statement that the nature of the characteristic is essenceless in dependence on the imputed characteristic.

original: 'di ni dang po'o /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o /
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This passage of the sutra is also divided into three parts:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi gnas kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid dang bye brag bstan pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang yongs su shes pa rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi gnas kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid dang bye brag bstan pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang yongs su shes pa rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The characteristics of the domain of conceptualization, the teaching on the intrinsic reality and differentiation of the form heap, the teaching on the origination and cessation of the form heap, and the analysis of the complete relinquishment and thorough knowledge of the form heap.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa nyid kun du gzhal ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa nyid kun du gzhal ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba nyid de /
translated: Here, the domain of conceptualization refers to the mind and mental factors that are the universal mental factors and the specific mental factors.

original: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni des brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa de'i spyod yul @48b yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul zhes bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni des brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa'i gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa de'i spyod yul @48b yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul zhes bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The domain is the intrinsic reality that is investigated by that conceptualization. The intrinsic reality of the form heap, etc., which is the true reality, is called the domain of conceptualization because it is the domain of that conceptualization.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na /
translated: In another enumeration of the explanation,

original: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang yin te /
analyzed: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang yin te /
translated: the domain is the other-dependent.

original: brtags pa'i gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i spyod yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i spyod yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc. , that are conceptually differentiated are the objective conditions of that conceptual differentiation, and are therefore called its domain.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dag la zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma dag la zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The signs of the formative forces that are the bases of the imaginary nature are described as follows:

original: kha cig na re 'du byed ni lta ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'du byed ni lta ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Some believe that the formative forces are the aspects of views,

original: 'du byed la bye brag tu dmigs pa'i shes pa'o //üîΩmtshan ma ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed la bye brag tu dmigs pa'i shes pa'o // mtshan ma ni rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: and that the signs are the consciousnesses that are specifically directed towards the formative forces.üîΩOthers believe that the signs are the aspects of the causal-signs,

original: dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan ma'o zhe'o ;
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan ma'o zhe'o ;
translated: and that the signs are the causal-signs that are to be directly realized.

original: / kha cig na re 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: / kha cig na re 'du byed kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: Others again believe that the signs of the formative forces are the aspects of the conditioned,

original: thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid do zhe'o //
translated: and that all are characterized by the relative aspect.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis las bshad pa ni phyi ma bzang ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis las bshad pa ni phyi ma bzang ngo //
translated: Of the two explanations, the latter is the better.

original: bshad pa snga ma dang sbyar na ni gzhan gyi dbang mi rungs te lta ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa snga ma dang sbyar na ni gzhan gyi dbang mi rungs te lta ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the former explanation is applied, the other-dependent is not suitable because it is the aspect of seeing and so on.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid spyir bstan pa la ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid spyir bstan pa la ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe essential nature and specific characteristics of the form heap are established by name and symbol‚Äù is a general presentation of the nature of the characteristics.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid la thag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid la thag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag ces bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúessential nature‚Äù refers to one‚Äôs own nature. The term ‚Äúspecific characteristics‚Äù refers to the distinctions that are made by such terms as ‚Äúwith outflows,‚Äù ‚Äúwithout outflows,‚Äù ‚Äúcapable of bearing an examination,‚Äù and ‚Äúincapable of bearing an examination.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po skye'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe form heap arises‚Äù is a presentation.

original: 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit ceases‚Äù is a presentation.

original: sngon med pa las yod par gyur ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa las yod par gyur ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúarises‚Äù means that it comes into being from a state in which it did not previously exist.

original: skyes nas med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'gag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skyes nas med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'gag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The term ‚Äúceases‚Äù means that it goes out of existence after it has come into being.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of intrinsic nature is the distinction between arising and ceasing.

original: skad cig mar skye zhing 'jig pa dang / thang cig tsam du gnas pa la sogs pa ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig mar skye zhing 'jig pa dang / thang cig tsam du gnas pa la sogs pa ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of particularity is the distinction between arising and ceasing moment by moment, lasting only an instant, and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang bar bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of matter that is defiled should be completely abandoned.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The aggregate of matter that is not defiled should be fully understood.

original: yang na kun 'byung ba'i don gyi mtha' gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na kun 'byung ba'i don gyi mtha' gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Or, the limit of the meaning of origination should be completely abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i don gyi mtha' gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i don gyi mtha' gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The limit of the meaning of the truth of suffering should be fully understood.

original: gtan du spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa de yang gtan du @49a * //
analyzed: gtan du spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa de yang gtan du @49a * //
translated: That complete abandonment and full understanding are also completely abandoned and fully understood.

original: spang ba spyir bstan pa gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: spang ba spyir bstan pa gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The general teaching of abandonment is called the essential nature of abandonment.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la sogs pas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang ba'i bye brag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la sogs pas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni gtan du spang ba'i bye brag ces bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of what is to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation is called the particular of abandonment.

original: gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid spyir shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid spyir shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The general knowledge of the essential nature of form is called the essential nature of thorough knowledge.

original: gzugs kyi phung po bye brag tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa'i bye brag ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po bye brag tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su shes pa'i bye brag ces bya ste /
translated: The particular knowledge of the aggregate of form is called the particular of thorough knowledge.

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This kind of establishment is called the imagined characteristic.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las ni mtshan nyid rnam pa drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las ni mtshan nyid rnam pa drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: In the chapter on the characteristic of ultimate truth, these six kinds of characteristics are explained as follows:

original: phung po thob pa'i phyir dang phung po'i mtshan ma thob pa'i phyir dang / phung po'i skye ba thob pa'i phyir dang / phung po 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bya ba thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan la /
analyzed: phung po thob pa'i phyir dang phung po'i mtshan ma thob pa'i phyir dang / phung po'i skye ba thob pa'i phyir dang / phung po 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir dang / phung po 'gog pa mngon du bya ba thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan la /
translated: Because of obtaining the aggregates, because of obtaining the signs of the aggregates, because of obtaining the arising of the aggregates, because of obtaining the cessation of the aggregates, and because of obtaining the realization of the cessation of the aggregates.

original: le'u 'di'i mgor ni mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga bstan cing /
analyzed: le'u 'di'i mgor ni mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga bstan cing /
translated: At the beginning of this chapter, five aspects of the characteristics were taught.

original: khong du chud pa'i skabs nas ni tshig drug 'byung na /
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i skabs nas ni tshig drug 'byung na /
translated: In the section on understanding, six phrases appear.

original: ci'i phyir snga phyi mi mthun par gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snga phyi mi mthun par gyur zhe na /
translated: Why are the earlier and later [teachings] inconsistent?

original: smras pa / snga phyir bstan pa rnams gcig tu bsdus na /
analyzed: smras pa / snga phyir bstan pa rnams gcig tu bsdus na /
translated: It is said: When the earlier and later teachings are combined into one,

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu yod de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu yod de /
translated: there are ten aspects of the characteristics.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las mtshan nyid rnam pa drug bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i le'ur yang mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u las mtshan nyid rnam pa drug bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i le'ur yang mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the chapter on the characteristics of ultimate truth, six aspects of the characteristics were taught, and in the chapter on the teaching of the lack of nature, two aspects of the characteristics were taught. They are as follows:

original: gtan du spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / khong du chud pa bstan pa'i skabs nas yang mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gtan du spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa dang / khong du chud pa bstan pa'i skabs nas yang mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The two kinds of characteristics are indicated in the section on the teaching of the abandonment of the eternal, the teaching of the understanding of the object, and the teaching of the penetration of the object.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The two kinds of characteristics are the characteristic of own-being and the characteristic of particularity.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu po de dag las rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir grangs kyang nges pa med pas bye brag gzhag nas spyi'i dbang du bya na ni mtshan nyid gcig kho na las med do /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa bcu po de dag las rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir grangs kyang nges pa med pas bye brag gzhag nas spyi'i dbang du bya na ni mtshan nyid gcig kho na las med do /
translated: From among these ten kinds of characteristics, the number is not fixed because of the characteristic of own-being and the characteristic of particularity. But if one sets aside the particular and takes the general, there is only one characteristic.

original: spyi gzhag nas bye brag gi dbang du byas te brjod na ni mtshan nyid gnyis kho na las med do //
analyzed: spyi gzhag nas bye brag gi dbang du byas te brjod na ni mtshan nyid gnyis kho na las med do //
translated: If one sets aside the general and takes the particular, there are only two characteristics.

original: spyi dang bye brag gnyi ga'i dbang du byas te brjod na ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum yod pas de'i phyir snga phyi'i bskyed pa dang / dbri ba dag mi mthun par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag gnyi ga'i dbang du byas te brjod na ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum yod pas de'i phyir snga phyi'i bskyed pa dang / dbri ba dag mi mthun par gyur ba yin no //
translated: If one speaks from the point of view of both the general and the particular, there are three kinds of characteristics. Therefore, the earlier and later explanations of the addition and subtraction are not contradictory.

original: 'dir khong du chud pa'i skabs nas ni khong du chud pa'i le'u dang po yin pa'i phyir tshig drug po de dag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir khong du chud pa'i skabs nas ni khong du chud pa'i le'u dang po yin pa'i phyir tshig drug po de dag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the six terms are stated because this is the first chapter on comprehension.

original: yang le 'u nyid kyi mgor mtshan @49b nyid drug kyang bstan te /
analyzed: yang le 'u nyid kyi mgor mtshan @49b nyid drug kyang bstan te /
translated: Also, at the beginning of the chapter, the six characteristics are taught.

original: 'di ltar phung po rnams kyang bstan pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po rnams kyang bstan pas na /
translated: Thus, since the aggregates are also taught,
